sen.j: 寺町通（てらまちどおり）は京都市の南北の通りの一つ。
sen.e: The Teramachi-dori Street is one of the major north-south running streets in Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Teramachi-dori Street is one of the major north-south running streets in Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
Teramachi-dori Street is one of the major north-south streets in Kyoto City.

sen.j: 北は紫明通から南は五条通まで。
sen.e: It runs from the Shimei-dori Street in the north to the Gojo-dori Street in the south.
It runs from Shimei-dori Street in the north to Gojo-dori Street in the south.
It runs from Shimei-dori Street in the north to Gojo-dori Street in the south.

sen.j: 平安京の東京極大路（ひがしきょうごくおおじ）にあたる。
sen.e: It corresponds to the Higasikyogoku-oji Street in Heiankyo.
It corresponds to the Higasikyogoku-oji Street in Heiankyo.
It corresponds to Higashikyogoku-oji Street in Heian-kyo.

sen.j: 都の東端の大路であったが、右京の衰退や相次ぐ戦乱等によって京都御所が移転したため、現在は京都御所の東端の通りとなっている。
sen.e: The street, which was once the main street and bordered the east edge of Heiankyo, is a street running along east side of Kyoto Gosho (Old Imperial Palace), because Kyoto Gosho was relocated to its present site after a decline of Ukyo (west part of capital) and repeated disorders.

The street, which was once the main street and bordered the east edge of Heiankyo, runs along east side of Kyoto Gosho (Old Imperial Palace), because Kyoto Gosho was relocated to its present site after a decline of Ukyo (the western part of the capital) and perpetuated disorder.

The street, which was once the main thoroughfare and bordered the east edge of Heian-kyo, runs along east side of Kyoto Gosho (Old Imperial Palace), because Kyoto Gosho was relocated to its present site after the decline of Ukyo (the western part of the capital) and perpetuated disorder.

sen.j: 豊臣秀吉による京都改造によって通りの東側に寺院が集められたことからこの名前になった。
sen.e: The street obtained its name "Teramchi" (literally temple district) because Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's re-creation of Kyoto made many temples move in the eastern side of this street.
The street obtained its name "Teramachi" (literally temple district) because Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's recreation of Kyoto led many temples to move into the east side of this street.
The street obtained the name "Teramachi (literally temple district)" because Hideyoshi TOYOTOMI's recreation of Kyoto led many temples to move into the east side of this street.

sen.j: 本能寺もこの時、現在の中京区元本能寺南町からこの通りに移された。
sen.e: Honno-ji Temple was also relocated along this street at this time from present-day Motohonnoji-minamicho, Nakagyo Ward.
Honno-ji Temple was also relocated along this street at this time from what is now Motohonnoji-minamicho, Nakagyo ward.
Honno-ji Temple was also relocated along this street at this time from what is now Motohonnoji-minami-cho, Nakagyo Ward.

sen.j: 寺を集めた目的は、税の徴収の効率化と京都の防衛であった。
sen.e: The purpose of bringing temples together in this district was levying tax efficiently and defending Kyoto.
The purpose of bringing temples together in this district was to levy taxes efficiently and defend Kyoto.
The purpose of bringing temples together in this district was to levy taxes efficiently and defend Kyoto.

sen.j: 東の御土居に沿うように寺を配置することで東から進入する軍勢の戦意の低下をねらったと言われる。
sen.e: Arranging temples in line with the city's eastern Odoi Fortress is said to have aimed at damping the morale of troops getting in the city from the east.
The arrangement of temples in line with the city's eastern Odoi Fortress is said to have been aimed at damping the morale of troops entering the city from the east.
The arrangement of temples in line with the city's eastern Odoi Fortress is said to have been aimed at damping the morale of troops entering the city from the east.

sen.j: かつては南北方向の主要な通りの一つであり、今出川通から二条通にかけては京都電気鉄道（のちに買収され京都市電）の路面電車が走っていた。
sen.e: The street was once the major north-south streets and Kyoto Municipal Steetcar (operated by Kyoto Electric Railway and later purchased by Kyoto City trams) ran from the Imadegawa-dori Street to the Nijo-dori Street.
sen.cmt: 京都電気鉄道→Kyoto Electric Railway (京都電気鉄道)[定訳不明]京都市電→Kyoto Municipal Steetcar (京都市電)[定訳不明]
sen.e: The street was once the major north-south thoroughfare, and Kyoto Municipal Steetcar (operated by Kyoto Electric Railway and later purchased by Kyoto City Trams) ran from Imadegawa-dori Street to Nijo-dori Street.

The street was once the major north-south thoroughfare, and steetcars (which were operated by Kyoto Electric Railway and later purchased by Kyoto City Trams) ran from Imadegawa-dori Street to Nijo-dori Street.
sen.cmt: 路面電車をstreet carとしました。

sen.j: 1920年代に河原町通が拡幅されると、市電のルートもそちらに移るなどメインストリートの座を譲った。
sen.e: When the Kawramachi-dori Street was widened in the 1920's and the tracks of the streetcars were transferred there, the Teramachi-dori Street yielded its position as a main street to the Kawaramachi-dori Street.
When Kawaramachi-dori Street was widened in the 1920s and the tracks of the streetcars were transferred there, Teramachi-dori Street yielded its position as a main street to Kawaramachi-dori Street.
When Kawaramachi-dori Street was widened in the 1920s and the tracks of the streetcars were transferred there, Teramachi-dori Street yielded its position as a main street to Kawaramachi-dori Street.

sen.j: 丸太町通から二条通までは、古美術店や画廊、古書店などが並ぶ寺町会の商店街である。
sen.e: The section from the Marutamachi-dori Street to the Nijo-dori Street is the shopping Street filled with antique stores, galleries, and antiquarian bookshops belonging to Teramachi Shopping District Promotion.

The section from Marutamachi-dori Street to Nijo-dori Street is a shopping street filled with antique stores, galleries and antiquarian bookshops belonging to the Teramachi Shopping District Promotion.

The section from Marutamachi-dori Street to Nijo-dori Street is a shopping street filled with antique stores, galleries and antiquarian bookshops belonging to the Teramachi Shopping District Promotion.

sen.j: 御池通から四条通に至る区間は、アーケードの商店街となっており、日中は車両進入禁止である。
sen.e: The section from the Oike-dori Street to Shijo-dori Street is an arcade of shops, closing to all traffic in the daytime.
The section from the Oike-dori Street to Shijo-dori Street is an arcade of shops, and it's closed to traffic during the daytime.
The section from the Oike-dori Street to Shijo-dori Street is an arcade of shops, and it's closed to traffic during the daytime.

sen.j: 御池通から三条通までは、寺町専門店街であり、新京極通と平行する三条通から四条通までは、寺町京極商店街である。
sen.e: The section from the Oike-dori Street to the Sanjo-dori Street is Teramachi Shopping Street, and the section from the Sanjo-dori Street to Shijo-dori Street, which parallels Shinkyogoku-dori Street, is the Teramachi-Kyogoku Shopping Street.

The section from Oike-dori Street to Sanjo-dori Street is Teramachi Shopping Street, and the section from Sanjo-dori Street to Shijo-dori Street, which parallels Shinkyogoku-dori Street, is the Teramachi-Kyogoku Shopping Street.

The section from Oike-dori Street to Sanjo-dori Street is Teramachi Shopping Street, and the section from Sanjo-dori Street to Shijo-dori Street, which parallels Shinkyogoku-dori Street, is the Teramachi-Kyogoku Shopping Street.

sen.j: また、四条通から高辻通にかけては、東京や大阪と比べると小規模ながら電気街になっており、京都の秋葉原やでんでんタウンといってもよい通りであったが、日本橋や大須同様に、往時と比べて電気店の数が減少し、新しい都心型のマンションなどが建設されている。
sen.e: The section between the Shijo-dori Street and Takatsuji-dori Street was once Kyoto's largest electronic quarter, which was smaller than in scale but can be compared to Akihabara and Denden Town, but now the electric goods shops decline in number from their flourishing past like in Nihonbashi and Osu and are being replaced by newly built urban style apartments.

The section between Shijo-dori Street and Takatsuji-dori Street was once Kyoto's largest electronic quarter, which was smaller than in scale but can be compared to Akihabara and Denden Town; now, however, the electric goods shops decline in number from their flourishing past, like in Nihonbashi and Osu, and are being replaced by new urban-style apartments.

The section between Shijo-dori Street and Takatsuji-dori Street was once Kyoto's largest electronic quarter, which was smaller than in scale but can be compared to Akihabara and Denden Town; now, however, the electric goods shops decline in number from their flourishing past, like in Nihonbashi and Osu, and are being replaced by new urban-style apartments.

sen.j: 御池通から四条通までが路上喫煙等禁止区域である。
sen.e: The street between the Oike-dori Street and the Shijo-dori Street is a Public Nonsmoking Area.
The street between Oike-dori Street and Shijo-dori Street is a public nonsmoking area.
The street between Oike-dori Street and Shijo-dori Street is a public nonsmoking area.

tit.cmt: 小文字で統一しています。
